Class LibraryDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • LibraryDB

  • public class LibraryDB
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a database in the form of a ArrayList that stores the all books.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kenny

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LibraryDB​()
      Constructs a new LibraryDB by taking the contents of the Books.txt file and placing them within the ArrayList by first generating their contents into a local PriorityQueue (for the purposes of sorting) and then migrating their contents into the global ArrayList.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<Book> getBooks​()
      Returns the ArrayList which contains all of the books.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Book> searchAuthor​(java.lang.String author)
      Returns a list of books filtered by a specific author
      static java.util.ArrayList<Book> searchDate​(java.lang.String date)
      Returns a list of books filtered by a specific date
      static java.util.ArrayList<Book> searchGenre​(java.lang.String genre)
      Returns a list of books filtered by a specific genre
      static java.util.ArrayList<Book> searchName​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a list of books filtered by a specific name.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Book> sortByAvailability​(boolean available, java.util.ArrayList<Book> b)
      Returns an arrayList based on the availability of all books.

      • getBooks

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Book> getBooks​()

      • sortByAvailability

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Book> sortByAvailability​(boolean available,
                                                           java.util.ArrayList<Book> b)
        Returns an arrayList based on the availability of all books. Based on the boolean, either available or unavailable books will appear first. For example, if the boolean is set to true, then all available books will appear first, FOLLOWED BY unavailable books.
        Parameters:
        available - whether the book is available or not
        b - an ArrayList of Books
        Returns:
        availableBooksFirst

        Returns:
        names
